term_definition: "Number of reads that cover a given nucleotide position."

"As defined by the Sequence ontology. Predict the effect of each allele of each variant on the transcript. Provides a score of impact based on position of variant in the transcript (e.g. splice site, UTR etc)."
"Breaking variants into multiple records – splitting multi-allelic sites into separate entries."
"Parents are homozygous reference whereas the child is a het (carries a copy of the alternate allele). A high confidence de novos would be sites where GQ > 20 across trio with AC <4 or AF <0.1%."

"Refers to the read between the paired end adaptors. Insert size should be ~ 300-500 bp for paired end sequencing. For illumina, this would be the difference between the 5 positions of the two reads."
"Extension of target region."
"Convention of shifting indels furthest left whilst keeping the length of the allele constant. Applies to situations where the indel position can be ambiguous (e.g. STR)."
"Multinucleotide and an indel at a position e.g. Reference = ATA Sample = GTCAGT."
"Multinucleotide variant e.g. Reference = ATA Sample = GTC– substitution mutations across consecutive bases."
"Describes application of both left alignment and parsimony."
"Representation of a variant by as few nucleotides as possible with allele length > 0. This involves trimming bases on either side of the variant."
"Person with the genetic disorder (usually the child)."

"Prefix XM are model refseqs. These represent predicted transcripts produced by an automated annotation pipeline and may differ from curated records. NM represent known transcripts with evidence available and curated."
"Tab-delimited text file containing aligned sequence data."
"Mutation event not well-modelled."
"Process of ascribing biological function/impact to variant calls."
"Genotype at this site, encoded 0 for ref and 1 for alt."
"Unfiltered allele depth (counts) – the number of reads at the position, including those that failed variant caller filters."
"Filtered allele depth (counts), including only those which passed variant caller filters."
"Normalised Phred-scaled likelihoods – the likelihood of the genotype scaled by quality."
"Quality of the assigned genotype. Calculated as the difference between two most likely genotypes (based on PL). Low GQ indicates low confidence in choosing one genotype over another."
"Biotype of a transcript or regulatory feature."
"Minor allele frequency, refers to the frequency at which the second most common allele occurs in a given population."
"Percentage of reads that map to reference genome."
"Uniquely mapped reads."
"Target mapped reads on or near target."
"Read depth. Vertical coverage. Number of times a given base position has been sequenced"
"Breadth of coverage. Read length * number of reads / haploid genome length. Higher read depth = more reliable consensus and improved accuracy."

"Ti/Tv. The ratio of synonomous to non-synonomous calls. Serves as a general indicator of quality as ratio should remain constant across a region. Reference values are available from the literature. Can be an indicator of poor mapping quality."
"Percentage of targeted bases that are covered by one or more reads."
"Genes, transcripts, proteins. Annotated set of reference sequences including genomic, transcript, and protein. A subset of annotations from UCSC and Ensembl."
"Subset of NCBI, defines genomic sequences to be used as reference standards for well-characterised genes."
"SNP variant database. Contains neutral and disease-causing variants."

"Structural variant database. contains insertions, deletions, duplications, inversions, multinucleotide substitutions, mobile element insertions, translocations, and complex chromosomal rearrangements. See dbSNP for single nucleotide substitutions."
"Catalogue of human variation. Population frequency based annnotation resource."

"Sets of reference genomes. to develop the technical infrastructure (reference standards, reference methods, and reference data) to enable translation of whole human genome sequencing to clinical practice."
"Catalogue Of Somatic Mutations In Cancer. Somatic mutations in human cancer. Curated database based on peer-reviewed literature."
"NCBI build of the human genome. 0-based coordinate system."
"UCSC build of the human genome. 1-based coordinate system."

"Gene & variant naming system. Human genes and genetic phenotypes. Focus on relationship between phenotype and genotype. Provides comprehensive description of mutations & corresponding clinical descriptions associated with genes. Evidence-based resource."

"Exome variant database. Dataset includes 60,000 unrelated individuals sequenced as part of various disease and population genetic studies. Data has been reprocesssed through the same pipeline and called jointly to increase consistency."
"Variant database. Draws from ENCODE tracks, UCSC tracks, OMIM, dbSNP, KEGG, and HPRD."
"Variant nomenclature check. Checks variant conforms to HGVS nomenclature."
"Process of assigning reads to positions on a reference genome. Mappers may only map a single read at a time and ignore all other reads."
"Sometimes synonymous with indel realignment. Checks over noisy regions for mismatches. Considers consensus across all reads to improve alignment quality."
"Process of assembling a genome without a reference."
"Contains known true parts of the human reference genome which are yet to be mapped to the reference e.g. regions of the centromere."
"Verification by re-sequencing the sample on a different platform."
"Structural nucleotide variant."
"Contents of a VCF are not standard. Slight differences each version."
"Copy number variant."
"Structural variant."
"Fasta file format with quality scores for each read."
"Mutation annotation format. Alternative to VCF for somatic datasets."
"Binary version of a sam file"
"Read mapping."
"Read mapping."
"Variant caller. Indels and SNPs not called simultaneously. Some issues with accuracy for indel calls."
"Mutation variant caller. Takes in tumour - normal pair."
"Quality score recalibration across variant calls. Alternative to applying hard quality thresholds. Uses covariates and curated reference datasets to correct quality scores."
"Checks and removal of sequencing adaptors."
"Software to mark or remove PCR duplicates."
"Heuristic somatic variant caller."
"Structural based annotation resource."
"In-silico genotyping based on snp calls."
"Typically a represents a flow-cell lane on a sequencer."
"Database of genomic variants. A curated catalogue of structural variants."
"Exome variant server."
"Software for the conversion of sequencer output to fastq."
"Reference indel dataset"
"A pair of samples from a patient, with one sample originating from an affected site."
"Variant call from a tumor sample with normal reads subtracted."
"Variant call from a tumor sample."
"vcf file field."
"vcf file field. Can contain genotype information."
"Short insertion or deletion."
"GC should be monitored each run as it effects the sequencing chemistry efficiency."
"Refers to acceptable coverage across target regions."
"A measure of how well a read has mapped to the gennome"
"Quality control programs comparing laboratory performance. Typically a reference sample is sent to each laboratory and the results compared."
"Origin and history of an object."
"Assessment of reliability prior to testing of patient specimens."
"Variant annotation package."
"Population frequency based annotation resource. To catalogue snp-based variation across ethical groups."
"In-silico prediction of impact based on scoring system or algorithm e.g. SIFT, polyphen, condel, CADD, VAAST. Prediction of pathogenicity."
"Annotation of disease causing variants."
"Region of interest. Typically represented as a bed file. Could be a list of genes of interest converted to a bed file. Padding sometimes added to the bed."
"Regions of the genome which are targeted or captured by the sequencing library. A list of these regions is normally supplied by the sequencing chemistry vendor."
"Heuristic ranking."
"Heuristic ranking. Pathogenicity prediction."
"https://www.nature.com/articles/nature15393"
"https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/documentation/article.php?id=6308"
"https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/documentation/article.php?id=6308"
"In Silico Proficiency Testing for Clinical Next-Generation Sequencing."

"Gargis, A. S., Kalman, L., Bick, D. P., Da Silva, C., Dimmock, D. P., Funke, B. H., ... & Nagarajan, R. (2015). Good laboratory practice for clinical next-generation sequencing informatics pipelines. Nature biotechnology, 33(7), 689-693."

term_name: "Next-Generation Sequencing Informatics: Challenges and Strategies for Implementation in a Clinical Environment"
"Standards and Guidelines for Validating Next-Generation Sequencing Bioinformatics Pipelines: A Joint Recommendation of the Association for Molecular Pathology"
"A reference data set of 5.4 million phased human variants validated by genetic inheritance from sequencing a three-generation 17-member pedigree"

term_definition: "Bahcall, O. G. (2015). Genomics: Benchmarking genome analysis pipelines. Nature Reviews Genetics, 16(4), 194-194."
